description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3c97o","text":"This protocol provides detailed, step-by-step instructions for students and researchers to annotate nuclear genomes, using the genome of the Asian bee Colletes collaris as an example. We begin with the identification of repetitive regions, followed by gene prediction, functional annotation of protein-coding genes, and identification of non-coding RNAs (ncRNAs and tRNAs).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":151,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
manuscript_citation: {"blocks":[{"key":"9da6g","text":"Rafael R Ferrari, Thiago M Batista, Qing-Song Zhou, Heron O Hilário, Michael C Orr, Arong Luo, Chao-Dong Zhu, The Whole Genome of Colletes collaris (Hymenoptera: Colletidae): An Important Step in Comparative Genomics of Cellophane Bees, Genome Biology and Evolution, Volume 15, Issue 5, May 2023, evad062, https://doi.org/10.1093/gbe/evad062","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":130,"length":17},{"style":"italic","offset":237,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":306,"length":35}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"91B18138285211EFA4D00A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.1093/gbe/evad062"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working
